intro: Mocanera plagata, commonly known as the golden bell tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble bells. The plant typically grows as a deciduous shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
